intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. spathulare, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of broadly ovate to spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are usually hairless and have a slightly rough texture. It is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and is characterized by its robust growth and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
